visualization_prompt: Generate a combination map and line chart showing Australian regional data relationships using Highcharts with SVG markers for directional annotations
visualization_explanation: The dataset combines geospatial and temporal dimensions, with Australian regional codes (categorical) linked to quantitative development indices (0-10 scale). Synthetic data follows normal distribution (μ=5.5, σ=2.1) with intentional spatial clustering showing higher values in resource-rich western regions. The map-line combination leverages Tufte's principles by using clear base maps with minimal administrative boundaries, while directional arrows employ Cairo's preattentive processing through marker orientation. Temporal line chart uses desaturated colors from the map's categorical palette to maintain visual continuity. Statistical anchors include Q4 performance targets annotated in D3.format precision (Western: +6.2% YoY, Eastern: +34% YoY).
